alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous, slow moving thunderstorms extending from Shulerville west to Carnes Crossroads. Some areas have received over an inch of rain in the last hour and as thunderstorms develop, an additional 1 to 2 inches can be expected through 315 PM. This will result in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Moncks Corner, Ladson, Huger, Crowfield Plantation, College Park, Richmond, Cordesville, Comingtee, Hagan, Ellwood, Limerick, Woodland Landing, Woodland, Mepkin, Old Cordesville, Pimlico and Cypress Gardens.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
